text: Randy Tat is an American television and film producer. He is most known for producing the television series Finding Andrea and the film Fourth Down and Love. He lives in Los Angeles, California. == Career == Tat was born in Seattle, Washington. Tat graduated from the Cornish College of the Arts and then attended University of Washington. Films developed by Tat include Jade, Mission Impossible, The Phantom, The Saint, The Out-of-Towners, and How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days. He has produced the TV series Finding Andrea, the podcast Families Who Kill: The Donut Shop Murders, the "Alaska Barn Rescue" episode of the TV series In with the Old, and the film Fourth Down and Love. Under the nickname "Tat on the Wall", Tat has displayed artwork and sculpture pieces across Southern California and Seattle Tat's paintings were shown in the 1992 film Wayne's World. He is a juror and panelist for the annual Julien Dubuque International Film Festival. == Filmography == === Films === Year Film Role Notes 1995 Jade Production Executive 1996 Mission Impossible 1996 The Phantom 1997 The Saint 1999 The Out-of-Towners 2003 How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days Production Associate === Television === Year Show Role Notes 2021 Finding Andrea Executive Producer 2022 Fine Flick Film Fest TV Pilot 2023 Fourth Down and Love TV Movie 2023 In With The Old Season 5, Episode 8 === Podcasts === Year Podcast Role Notes 2022 Families Who Kill: The Donut Shop Murders Executive Producer == References == == Other websites == * Randy Tat at IMDb Category:American producers Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:People from Seattle
title: Randy Tat
